required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Spectacle Independence After Implantation of Trifocal and Trifocal Toric Intraocular Lenses Using Intraoperative Aberrometry: A Prospective Analysis

lead_sponsor.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

clinical_study.source: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to evaluate subject outcomes and spectacle independence with intraoperative aberrometry and trifocal IOL implantation.

primary_outcome.description: This will be assessed by a Visual Quality Questionnaire, an 18 question multiple choice questionnaire to assess vision-related functioning. Grading scale: 0, no difficulty; 1, a little difficulty; 2, moderate difficulty; 3, quite difficult; 4, impossible to perform. Mean value(s) will be analyzed.

This will be assessed by a Visual Quality Questionnaire, an 18 question multiple choice questionnaire to assess vision-related functioning. Grading scale: 0, no difficulty; 1, a little difficulty; 2, moderate difficulty; 3, quite difficult; 4, impossible to perform. Mean value(s) will be analyzed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Spectacle independence for distance, intermediate and near

secondary_outcome.measure: Binocular, uncorrected distance visual acuity for patients within 0.50 D of intended target
secondary_outcome.description: This will be measured by visual acuity

secondary_outcome.measure: Uncorrected binocular and monocular visual acuity at all distances
secondary_outcome.description: This will be measured by visual acuity

secondary_outcome.description: This will be measured by refractive error

intervention.intervention_name: Alcon Trifocal and Trifocal Toric Intraocular Lenses
intervention.description: Panoptix Model #TFAT00 for the UV Absorbing Trifocal IOL. Torics: TFAT30, TFAT40, TFAT50, TFAT60

study_pop.textblock: Subjects with a diagnosis of visually-significant cataracts who meet the inclusion and exclusion criteria will be eligible for participation in this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Able to consent to study and cataract surgery
- Visually significant cataract
- Potential post-operative visual acuity of 20/25 or better
- Age 18 years or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ocular pathology contraindicated for trifocal IOLs including but not limited to diabetic retinopathy, age-related macular degeneration or other macular pathology, cornea guttata, corneal scarring, corneal ectasia, glaucoma with visual field loss
- Irregular astigmatism
- Prior corneal refractive surgery
